author: Special Correspondent
text:
Scintillating show marks Heritage College Day

The sprawling lawn, the Rapinat Herbarium and Newton Natural History Museum, which are part of the prestigious St. Joseph’s College premises, came alive with scintillating performance on and off the dais when it observed Heritage College Day on Wednesday to commemorate the Heritage Status award extended by the University Grants Commission (UGC).

The towering age old buildings, which have played a key role in getting the coveted tag, the museum and others were illuminated.

The gathering, which included priests, octogenarian alumni, retired, and serving professors and hundreds of students roared to the occasion when it was announced that St. Joseph’s College was the only educational institution in the State to get the distinction. The colourful audience never missed an opportunity to express their joy when its milestones were highlighted by a video presentation with music and dance show.

Rev. John Britto, Rector, said the heritage status had become a yet another milestone of the college that had been serving the humanity for several decades. It had added value to the institution.

Rev. Andrew, Principal, said it was an honour to the illustrious service of the college, Jesuits, retired and serving teaching and non teaching staff, thousands of alumni and students.
title: St. Joseph’s College celebrates in style
